# Chris Olberding

> Marketing executive and technologist writing about brand, technology, and marketing at olberding.me. VP of Marketing at a Top 50 U.S. commercial bank. Former agency founder and CEO.

Chris Olberding has spent nearly two decades at the intersection of brand, technology, and marketing. He built and sold a digital agency, managed eight-figure media budgets, and leads acquisition strategy for a Top 50 U.S. bank. He writes about marketing measurement, organizational design, AI in marketing, and leadership.

## Pages

- [About](https://olberding.me/about): Background, skills, experience timeline, and interests
- [Home](https://olberding.me/): Blog post listing and homepage

## Blog Posts

- [Making the Invisible Visible: A Practical Guide to Media Mix Modeling for Mid-Sized Companies](https://olberding.me/blog/media-mix-modeling): A practical orientation to media mix modeling for mid-sized companies: what it does, when it makes sense, how it interacts with attribution and incrementality testing, and what your options look like for getting started.
- [Right-Sizing Marketing Measurement](https://olberding.me/blog/marketing-measurement-by-budget): A framework for thinking about marketing measurement expectations by organizational size and resource availability â€” from small businesses getting the basics right to enterprises that need will, not direction.
- [Putting GEO Into Context: Lessons for Executives from Early Days of SEO](https://olberding.me/blog/geo-lessons-from-early-seo): Before investing heavily in Generative Engine Optimization, we should learn from the uncertainty, opportunistic consulting, and rapid shifts that marked the emerging SEO industry.
- [Empathetic Transactionalism: The Space Between Family and Transaction](https://olberding.me/blog/empathetic-transaction): An introduction to empathetic transactionalism: a mental model for the manager/report relationship that is honest about the exchange without treating it as the whole of what the relationship requires.
- [The Beer-Belly Organization](https://olberding.me/blog/beer-belly-organization): Organizations, like bodies, accumulate weight in the middle. Here's how to recognize the pattern and what leaders can do to restore organizational fitness.
- [Beyond GEO and SEO: The Case for a Unified Digital Brand Presence Model](https://olberding.me/blog/beyond-geo-seo-digital-brand-presence): SEO and GEO are treated as separate disciplines, but they share a common foundation. It's time for a unified model of digital brand presence.
- [Building an AI-Empowered Marketing Organization](https://olberding.me/blog/ai-empowered-marketing-organization): A practical framework for integrating AI into marketing organizations without losing the human judgment that makes marketing work.
- [Building a Marketing Organization: Models and Structures of Agency Utilization](https://olberding.me/blog/marketing-organization-agency-models): A framework for how in-house marketing departments should think about structuring their agency relationships.
- [Triangulating Truth: A Model for Marketing Measurement](https://olberding.me/blog/triangulating-truth-marketing-measurement): Attribution models lie. So do surveys and incrementality tests. But by triangulating across all three, marketers can get closer to the truth about what's actually working.
